bio: Gordon James Ramsay Jr. OBE is a British chef, restaurateur, writer and television personality. He was born in Johnstone, Scotland, and raised in Stratford-upon-Avon, England. His restaurants have been awarded 16 Michelin stars in total.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 200C. Season the beef with salt and pepper. Sear the beef in a hot pan with oil for 1-2 minutes on each side. Wrap the beef in parma ham and mushrooms. Roll out the puff pastry and wrap the beef. Brush with egg wash and bake for 20-25 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

Boil the lobster for 5-6 minutes. Remove the meat from the shell and reserve the shells. Make a stock from the shells and white wine. Cook the arborio rice in the stock until al dente. Add the lobster meat, butter, and parmesan cheese. Stir until the cheese is melted and serve hot.

Season the ground beef with salt and pepper. Form the beef into a patty and cook on a hot grill for 3-4 minutes on each side. Toast the burger bun on the grill. Assemble the burger with lettuce, tomato, and cheese.

bio: James Trevor Oliver MBE is a British chef and restaurateur. He is known for his approachable cuisine, which has led him to front numerous television shows and open many restaurants. He has written over 30 cookbooks and is estimated to be worth £240 million.
